topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d83e563687253e44c0000#post_537d83e563687253e44c0000
Algae I feel is the best way of all. We can grow as much as we need and don't have to invest much in the infrastructure for it. Because it can grow almost anywhere it will not compete with farmland or any other kind of desirable land. We could grow the algae way out in the desert where no crops could grow or even out at sea. Wind power depends on wind and sometimes there just isn't a lot of wind a some days, the same with solar depending on the sun and there being a cloudy day.

topics.body: I have an idea about terraforming the inhabited regions of the Atacama Desert. We could create artificial lakes and reservoirs, and plant edible desert plants such as prickly pear. This could prevent deaths from dehydration and starvation.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d85746368720b57390000#post_537d85746368720b57390000
I have issues about messing with one of the most beautiful places in the world. Look up the Valley of the Moon for example. The Atacama is the driest place in the world so dehydration most certainly could be a problem however to put in artificial lakes in a place which has been without water for millions of years could very well upset its ecosystem. I feel a much better way would be to either have it trucked in using trucks running on natural fuel or run an above ground pipe. But that's just getting the water there, what about waste water? A septic system would not work in the desert as the soil would have issues absorbing the water. It could of course just evaporate but then you have issues with the water leaving contaminates in the ground plus you have issues with increasing the humidity in that area which could have an effect on the weather. A sewer system could work and I think would be the best way to go as the water could be somewhat recycled. As far as plants, try growing Amaranth, it's a very nutritious plant that can grow in many places including places with little water and needs very little care to grow it.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d88b9636872406a5e0000#post_537d88b9636872406a5e0000
_And people are more important than the ecosystem._

Wat

Without the ecosystem all humans would die. We would have no oxygen to breathe from plants, no plants to eat, no animals who eat plants to eat, and no animals who eat plant-eating animals to eat. We humans are no more important then the ecosystem, we are _part_ of it!
